Dear Ms. LaRue:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243 -9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001460
Special Investigation Intake Date: May 28, 2024
License #: CP280201153
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Barbara LaRue
Agency Name: Grand Traverse/Leelanau/Kalkaska DHHS
Agency Address: 701 S. Elmwood Ave. Suite 19
Traverse City, MI 49684-3185
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 12/06/2025
II. METHODOLOGY

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Placement
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12404
Section • (2) Initial consideration must be given to placement with a
Description relative or placing siblings together, or both.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster youth was moved from a relative placement and placed in
an unrelated foster home rather than with another willing relative.
There are concerns regarding placement preservation and
placement decisions by the agency.
Investigation Maternal Aunt (Complainant) was interviewed via Microsoft
Teams on 5/30/2024. She reported a detailed synopsis with dates
of the alleged allegation and what occurred with her, the Kalkaska
DHHS staff and Youth A. She reports Youth A was placed in her
home on 5/13/2024. She stated Foster Care Worker (FCW)
contacted her for the first time to touch base about Youth A on
5/14/2024. The Maternal Aunt said on 5/15/2024, FCW contacted
her around 7:00am to set up a home visit to talk with her regarding
Youth A and to complete paperwork. She said on the same day
she texted FCW and stated to her she was not sure she was a
good fit for Youth A to be placed in her home because she has
never taken care of a child before and he was a hand full. She
said she and FCW discussed other options for Youth A to be
placed. The Maternal Aunt said later on that day, FCW called her
and said the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)
had found Youth A another placement and to have Youth A ready
to leave her home the next morning. The Maternal Aunt said she
told FCW she was having a hard time and was seeking some help
or assistance with Youth A, and she had changed her mind and
decided she wanted to keep Youth A.
The Maternal Aunt stated on 5/16/2024, she met with FCW at her
home to discuss Youth A’s placement and finding a foster home
willing to take Youth A if the Maternal Aunt changes her mind
about keeping Youth A down the road. Maternal Aunt said she
was informed by the FCW she needed to be sure if she wanted to
keep Youth A in her home because he is her nephew and Youth A
was in a relative placement. Maternal Aunt said she told FCW
that she will let her know her decision of keeping Youth A in her
home by the end of that week to determine how his behaviors
2

were and if she could handle him. Maternal Aunt said FCW told
her to schedule a doctor and dentist appointment within 30 days
for Youth A and informed her that a scheduled appointment with
Community Mental Health (CMH) had already been scheduled.
Maternal Aunt said she received a text message from FCW
informing her that Youth A had an appointment on 5/17/2024 at
11:20am in Kalkaska and if the time and date did not work for the
Maternal Aunt, to let FCW know. Maternal Aunt said she told
FCW she had already scheduled a doctor and dentist appointment
for Youth A in June 2024, and she preferred Youth A go to a
pediatric office she felt was more appropriate. She said FCW
texted her and said unfortunately, the appointment for Youth A at
CMH had already been scheduled and Youth A needed to be
ready to go at 10:00am the next morning. Maternal Aunt said she
felt DHHS was rude with such short notice of the appointment for
Youth A and was bulling her to agree with them regarding the
CMH appointment. Maternal Aunt said no one asked her if she
was available for that day.
Maternal Aunt said it was an unpleasant discussion between her
and FCW because she was not going to have Youth A ready the
next day for the appointment DHHS had scheduled. She said
FCW worker told her Youth A was under DHHS jurisdiction and
she could not withhold Youth A from his scheduled appointments.
She said she told FCW she had already scheduled Youth A’s
appointments and she was not going to be available on 5/17/2024
to take him to appointments DHHS had scheduled without getting
her approval. Maternal Aunt said FCW texted her back and stated
that she (Maternal Aunt) was denying access to Youth A and she
was calling law enforcement to do a well-being check.
Maternal Aunt stated Youth A was happy, healthy and thriving in
her care. She said she received a telephone call from FCW’s
supervisor stating an emergency meeting was scheduled at
2:00pm on 5/17/2024 by way of video chat. She said the Foster
Care Supervisor called and had spoken with Youth A around
10:00am that morning. She said after she spoke with Youth A,
Maternal Aunt received an invite for another emergency meeting.
Maternal Aunt said the Team Decision Making (TDM) meeting
occurred; she voiced her opinion and DHHS voiced their opinion.
She said all agreed Youth A was going to remain in her care. She
said she provided all of the medical dates and times for Youth A
she had scheduled. Maternal Aunt stated DHHS discussed how
she needs to have better communication with them and the TDM
ended.
3

Maternal Aunt said she talked with FCW on 5/20/24, to discuss
how the weekend went with Youth A. She said she told FCW she
did not feel comfortable with Youth A in her home, and she
wanted to give Youth A the option to choose what Youth A wanted
because she did not want Youth A to feel like she did not want
him. Maternal Aunt said a home visit was scheduled in her home
on 5/22/24 to discuss placement of Youth A.
Maternal Aunt stated she texted FCW on 5/22/24 and told FCW
that something came up and she was cancelling the meeting
because she was going up north to assist her grandmother with
her aunt’s funeral, who had passed away. She said she received
a telephone call informing her that another emergency meeting
was being held on 5/23/24 at 11:00am, which she attended to
discuss the breakdown of the communication barriers causing
safety concerns of Youth A and DHHS had found a placement for
Youth A. She said she told FCW and Foster Care Supervisor at
the last meeting that she did nothing wrong, and this was “bull
crap” and Youth A was not going anywhere without a court order.
She said she left the meeting.
Maternal Aunt said she received messages from multiple different
agency workers and law enforcement threatening her and
charging her with kidnapping and withholding Youth A from the
assigned foster care worker.
Maternal Aunt said she informed everyone that called and texted
her that Youth A was not in any danger, and she was dealing with
the death of her aunt which caused her to reschedule the days
visit and appointment for the next week. Maternal Aunt said there
was no issue with the judge’s court order provided to her by law
enforcement saying she had to surrender Youth A and that Youth
A was to be taken from her care. She said she and Youth A left
her home and headed up north.
Maternal Aunt said on Friday, 5/24/2024, while getting into her car
from her aunt’s house up north, she was stopped by a police
officer and Youth A was taken into custody. She said she has
heard nothing from anyone since and another one of her aunts is
willing to take Youth A, but DHHS did not consider this relative
placement.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via Microsoft
Teams on 5/30/2024. Her account of dates regarding placement
with Youth A and his Maternal Aunt was slightly different from
4

Youth A’s Maternal Aunts’ dates. She stated Youth A was placed
with Maternal Aunt on 5/13/2024. She said about two days later
Maternal Aunt called her and requested Youth A be moved from
her home as soon as possible as she was overwhelmed with
providing for his care.
The FCW stated she went to Maternal Aunt’s home on 5/16/2024
to complete an announced home visit with Maternal Aunt and
Youth A. FCW said Maternal Aunt said at this time she would
prefer for Youth A to remain in her care despite her previous
request for a placement change. FCW said she informed
Maternal Aunt to please let her know if she changes her mind
about the placement down the road. She said she and Maternal
Aunt discussed initial medical appointments for Youth A. She
stated Maternal Aunt reported to her that she was unable to
provide transportation for Youth A’s initial medical appointments
and requested DHHS schedule and provide transportation to
these appointments. FCW said she informed Maternal Aunt that
Youth A had a medical appointment scheduled on 5/21/2024, with
community mental health and to have Youth A ready by 10:am to
go to his appointment as a transporter would be there to pick him
up. She said she also informed Maternal Aunt that in the future,
she could request gas cards for transportation and DHHS would
provide this to her.
FCW stated she and the case aid exchanged several text
messages with Maternal Aunt informing her of the scheduled
medical appointment for Youth A regarding the date and time for
pick up. The FCW said the Maternal Aunt said she was unable to
transport Youth A to this appointment due to a lack of financial
means for gas money. The FCW stated that she informed the
Maternal Aunt that the department offers assistance with gas
cards for transportation. The FCW said she informed the Maternal
Aunt that due to the appointment scheduled for 5/21/2024, the
department had arranged transportation for the doctor’s
appointment for Youth A. FCW stated that the Maternal Aunt was
aware of the appointment and the arrangements by the
department. FCW worker stated the case aid arrived at Maternal
Aunt’s home on 5/21/2024, to transport Youth A to his doctor’s
appointment. FCW stated the case aid called her (FCW) stating
no one answered the doorbell or telephone calls. FCW said she
tried calling Maternal Aunt’s telephone and she also received no
answer.
FCW said after numerous attempts and her concern for Youth A,
she contacted the Osceola County Sheriff’s Department in an
5

attempt to go to Maternal Aunt’s home to complete a well-being
check but, Maternal Aunt did not respond to law enforcement. She
said at this point and after discussing the situation with Foster
Care Supervisor, DHHS considered Youth A absent without legal
permission (AWOL). The FCW stated upon arrival to Maternal
Aunt’s home on 5/23/2024, by the Osceola County Sheriff, the
Maternal Aunt did not engage in any conversation with the officer.
However, the officer sent a picture of the emergency court order to
Maternal Aunt that demanded she relinquish Youth A immediately.
The Maternal Aunt did not respond to the court order.
The Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was interviewed via
Microsoft Teams on 5/30/2024. She stated after numerous
attempts she received contact from Maternal Aunt. She said
Maternal Aunt informed her she was not at her home and Youth A
was with her unapproved substitute caregiver despite the
scheduled appointment with DHHS. FCS stated Maternal Aunt
refused to provide Youth A’s location and refused to provide
information regarding the unapproved substitute caregiver in order
for necessary background checks to be completed. FCS said a
TDM was facilitated to discuss concerns and Maternal Aunt
continued refusal to disclose Youth A’s whereabouts. FCS said
Maternal Aunt did permit her (FCS) to conduct a virtual contact
with Youth A via facetime. FCS said FCW had a visit scheduled
at Maternal Aunt’s home for 5/22/2024 and Maternal Aunt
cancelled the visit.
FCS stated a TDM meeting was held on 5/23/2024 to discuss
concerns and Youth A’s placement with Maternal Aunt. She said
Maternal Aunt joined the meeting a half hour late. She said it was
recommended Youth A be moved from Maternal Aunt’s home
immediately due to lack of compliance and unwillingness to allow
DHHS to see Youth A in person. FCS stated Maternal Aunt said
she would not release Youth A from her care without a specific
court order. FCS said Maternal Aunt hung up the phone after
hearing the recommendation. FCS said during this meeting,
Maternal Aunt appeared on a video call from her vehicle with
Youth A in the vehicle. FCS said the vehicle appeared to be filled
with hers and Youth A’s belongings. FCS stated law enforcement
from Osceola County and Kalkaska County Sheriff’s Departments
would be sought to locate Maternal Aunt and Youth A.
FCS stated she had a conversation with Maternal Aunt’s, Relative
who stated now that Youth A had been found and is currently with
Maternal Aunt, she wanted Youth A to be released in Relative’s
care. FCS said she informed Relative that someone would be in
6

contact with her as discussed prior regarding the process. FCS
said Relative replied to her (FCS) to come on out, right now. FCS
said she informed Relative that DHHS would contact her to
complete the process, and in the meantime, the FCS said she
obtained Relative’s name and date of birth.
The FCS stated she had a discussion with Maternal Aunt and
Relative for Youth A’s next potential placement. The FCS stated
both Maternal Aunt and Relative knew they had been given the
verbal instructions to relinquish Youth A to the local MDHHS office
and/or law enforcement. She said neither chose to contact law
enforcement or MDHHS as required. The FCS said the sheriff
from Kalkaska County continued surveillance on the relative home
where the Maternal Aunt’s car was parked until 6:30am the next
morning. Maternal Aunt came out of Relative’s home and got into
her vehicle at 6:30am and this is when the Kalkaska Sheriff was
able to intervene and apprehend Youth A.
The FCS stated being Relative was not forthcoming nor did she
encourage Maternal Aunt to take Youth A to the nearest law
enforcement office or MDHHS office it was deemed appropriate
that her home was not a viable option for Youth A’s placement at
this time. The FCS said Youth A was placed with in a licensed
unrelated foster home on 5/24/2024.
Documents Reviewed:
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Department report dated
5/23/2024, case ID number, 2469400396. The sergeant
report stated an attempt was made to engage with Maternal
Aunt and to provide the emergency court order from the
courts. Maternal Aunt refused to communicate with the
sergeant after the order was provided. There was no other
information on this report.
• Court Order dated 5/23/24, states, Maternal Aunt shall
surrender Youth A to DHHS.
• Kalkaska County Sheriff’s Department report dated
5/24/2024, case ID244001807. The sergeant report stated
the sergeants were competing a surveillance at the house
that Maternal Aunt’s vehicle was parked outside at. At
approximately 6:30am he observed Maternal Aunt come
out of the house (unapproved substitute caregiver’s home)
with Youth A. Law enforcement intervened and pulled in
front of the vehicle and activated his emergency lights to
initiate a traffic stop. He made contact with Maternal Aunt,
and she advised the sergeant that she knew why she was
7

stopped. The sergeant reported Youth A was in the back
seat and Maternal Aunt was hesitant to provide information
and was verbally resisting. He reported Maternal Aunt
exited the vehicle as requested and when he opened the
rear right door Maternal Aunt placed herself in the rear right
of his patrol vehicle and refused to give him Youth A. He
said later, Maternal Aunt stated that Youth A belongs to
DHHS. The sergeant reported Maternal Aunt admitted to
declining to answer calls and text messages from DHHS.
He reported he contacted FCW who arrived on the scene,
picked up Youth A but not without a discussion with
Maternal Aunt. The scene was cleared without further
incident.
• MiSACWIS social work contact (SWC) dated 5/23/24.
The FCS writes that Relative of Maternal Aunt contacted
her and said Youth A would be traumatized if he had to go
with law enforcement. She said Relative said she would
take placement of Youth A to avoid him going to a foster
home. She said Relative said Youth A could come to her
house and be in a guardianship placement. FCS writes that
Relative was advised the screening process will need to
take place before consideration of placement. FCS writes
she encouraged Relative to connect with DHHS.
• MiSACWIS social work contact (SWC) dated 5/24/24.
The FCS writes the relatives of Youth A’s inquiry was
explored and other than Maternal Aunt, the relatives that
were identified either denied placement of Youth A or were
not found to be a viable option. There is no other relative
options noted.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as, options were explored with
other relatives prior to placing Youth A with Maternal Aunt. Other
relatives denied placement, or they were not viable.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
8/14/2024

Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
